summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for whom discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney who signed the letter providing the password for discovery materials.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Materials Password Provided
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell's case to the detention center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (BOP number 02879-509).
The letter indicates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence sharing in the Maxwell case as of October 2020.
Audrey Strauss was serving as Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at this time.
The document shows standard legal procedure for transmitting sensitive discovery materials to a detention facility.
